qas.question: What demarcates a clear distinction between nation and state, as well as religion and state?
What was divided into governance, administration, defense, law and  order?
What was the governing body of the Hindu states?
What political philosophy does not make a clear distinction between nation and state or religion state
What evolved over time and is based on legal treaties and obscure social institutions?
Who state institutions were divided into narrow well-defined entities?
What governing body of the states listed of the Prime Minister and civil servants?

plausible_answers.text: the King, Prime Minister, Commander in chief of army, Chief Priest of the King.

qas.question: What did political and legal treatisies consist of in Indian government?

plausible_answers.text: political and legal treatises and prevalent social institutions

qas.question: What were the constitutions of Maha states based on?

plausible_answers.text: broadly divided into governance, administration, defense, law and order

qas.question: How was the committee of ministers divided?
What prevalant social institution made a clear line between nation and religion?
What was the governing body of the head of executive?

context: <a0_0><b3_0><b10_0>Indian political philosophy<b10_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> evolved in ancient times and demarcated a clear distinction between (1) nation and state (2) religion and state. The constitutions of <b4_0><b5_0>Hindu states<b5_0/><b4_0/> evolved over time and were based on <b8_0>political and legal treatises and prevalent social institutions<b8_0/>. <a1_0>The institutions of state<a1_0/> were <b9_0>broadly divided into governance, administration, defense, law and order<b9_0/>. <a2_0><b6_0><b11_0>Mantranga<b11_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>, the principal governing body of these states, consisted of <b7_0>the King, Prime Minister, Commander in chief of army, Chief Priest of the King.<b7_0/> The Prime Minister headed the committee of ministers along with head of executive (Maha Amatya).
